cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast through the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the northeast Gulf Coast of Florida (Big Bend/Tampa Bay area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast, roughly Cedar Key–Aucilla River area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Indian Pass FL, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Chokoloskee northward to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay and the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (71% chance of ≥34 kt, up to 32% chance of ≥50 kt) with the possibility of hurricane-force gusts if Idalia intensifies just offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft above ground level possible in Tampa Bay including Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with local maxima up to 10 inches could produce flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, dangerous seas, and heavy wave action in lower Tampa Bay.
